definition_1: To remove the contents of a suitcase, box, or package.
definition_2: To take things out of their storage or transportation container.
definition_3: To remove items that have been packed for a trip or move.
definition_4: To analyze or discuss the components of an idea.
example_1: As soon as we arrived, I started to unpack my clothes.
example_2: It took them three days to completely unpack all the boxes from the move.

definition_1: A medium-sized motor vehicle, usually box-shaped, used for transporting goods or people.
definition_2: A covered vehicle used for moving furniture or delivering packages.
definition_3: A large road vehicle used for group transport.
definition_4: A smaller version of a truck.
example_1: The delivery driver arrived in a white cargo van.
example_2: We rented a large passenger van for the family road trip.

definition_1: A group of lines forming a unit in a poem or song (a stanza).
definition_2: Writing arranged in metrical rhythm (poetry).
definition_3: A numbered section of a chapter in the Bible.
definition_4: A rhythmic piece of poetry.
example_1: Can you sing the second verse of that song again?
example_2: The preacher read a verse from the New Testament.

definition_1: An object used for fighting or hunting.
definition_2: A tool used to cause damage or to defend oneself.
definition_3: Anything used to gain an advantage or attack an opponent (figurative).
definition_4: An instrument of attack or defense.
example_1: The suspect was arrested for carrying a concealed weapon.
example_2: His sharp wit and intelligence are his most powerful weapons.

definition_1: A fine network of threads constructed by a spider.
definition_2: A complex system of interconnected things or people.
definition_3: Short for the World Wide Web (the internet).
definition_4: A net-like structure.
example_1: I had to duck to avoid walking right into a large spider web.
example_2: The detective discovered a complicated web of lies.

definition_1: A cereal grain that is the most important food crop in the world.
definition_2: The plant from which flour is made, used to bake bread.
definition_3: A grain used in making bread, pasta, and cereals.
definition_4: The essential crop grown in large fields.
example_1: The golden fields of wheat were ready for harvest.
example_2: Many people around the world eat products made from wheat flour every day.
